db:article.db:para: Qt Quick Controls offers a selection of navigation models.

db:listitem.db:para: Side panel that can be opened and closed using a swipe gesture.
Enables the user to navigate pages by swiping sideways.
Allows the user to switch between different views or subtasks.
Button with a look suitable for a TabBar.

db:article.db:para: The following sections offer guidelines for choosing the appropriate type of navigation model, depending on the use case.

db:section.db:title: StackView Control
db:section.db:para: StackView provides a stack-based navigation model which can be used with a set of interlinked pages. StackView works according to a last-in first-out principle: the page pushed last on the stack is the one visible. Popping a page removes the last page and makes the previous one visible.

db:section.db:title: SwipeView Control
db:section.db:para: SwipeView provides a navigation model that simplifies horizontal paged scrolling. The page indicator on the bottom shows which is the presently active page.

db:section.db:title: TabBar Control
db:section.db:para: TabBar is a bar with icons or text that allows the user to switch between different subtasks, views, or modes.

db:section.db:title: TabButton Control
db:section.db:para: TabButton is a button with a layout suitable for a TabBar control.
